intro: Chamisme longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf chamis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, yellowish flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Chamisme longifolia is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid environments.
